meanings.definition: To remove or take off a mitre.
meanings.sent1: The bishop had to unmitre before entering the humble village church.
meanings.sent2: After the ceremony, the priest carefully unmitred himself.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved making the mitre disappear, forcing him to unmitre.
meanings.sent4: As the king abdicated, he symbolically unmitred himself, relinquishing his power.
meanings.sent5: The knight's duty was to unmitre the nobleman before his trial.

meanings.sent1: The jealous advisor plotted to unmitre the bishop and take his place.
meanings.sent2: The rebellious faction sought to unmitre the religious leader and establish their own rule.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous imp's prank was to unmitre all the statues in the cathedral.
meanings.sent4: The evil sorcerer's curse was to unmitre the king, stripping him of his divine authority.
meanings.sent5: The prophecy foretold that a traitor would unmitre the chosen one, leading to chaos.

meanings.sent1: The humble monk preferred his unmitre attire, blending in with the common folk.
meanings.sent2: The unmitre priest stood out among the clergy, embracing simplicity over grandeur.
meanings.sent3: The unmitre statue of the saint was a symbol of humility and modesty.
meanings.sent4: In the kingdom of the unmitre, all were equal regardless of rank or title.
meanings.sent5: The unmitre pilgrim journeyed without the trappings of wealth or status, seeking spiritual enlightenment.
